user.title: SAX Battery Configuration
user.description: Set up your SAX Battery system to integrate with Home Assistant.

data.battery_count: Select your number of batteries (1 to 3)

control_options.title: Control Options
control_options.description: Configure how you want Home Assistant to interact with your SAX Battery system. You can continue without selecting any of this option, this will just add the sensors. The added option here require you to contact SAX's customer service.

data.pilot_from_ha: Control battery from Home Assistant replacing the SAX smartmeter (you need register 41 and 42 set to write).
data.limit_power: Enable power limitations (you need registers 43 and 44 to be writable). Once setup, you can create automations that send the proper values to this number entity with your own rules.

pilot_options.title: Battery Control Settings
pilot_options.description: Configure advanced battery control parameters when Home Assistant is managing your battery system.

data.auto_pilot_interval: Control Update Interval (seconds), 60 seconds should be enough

sensors.title: Power Monitoring Sensors
sensors.description: Select the sensors that monitor your home's power usage for intelligent battery control.

data.power_sensor: Power Consumption Sensor, in Watts, a negative value means consuming from the grid and positive value equals injection into the grid
data.pf_sensor: Power Factor Sensor, called cos(phi) or PF

priority_devices.title: Priority Devices setup
priority_devices.description: Select devices that will get priority over the battery, if power above 50W is detected battery will neither charge nor discharge. This is typically an EV charger

data.priority_devices: Priority Devices, if enabled, battery will not discharge or charge

battery_config.title: Battery Connection Settings
battery_config.description: Configure connection details for each of your SAX Battery units.

init.title: SAX Battery Options
init.description: Update your SAX Battery configuration settings.
